intro: Stirtonia chrysantha, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Stirtonia chrysantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
